text: Which NLP tools do we have in Julia as it is?

elements.text: Which NLP tools do we have in Julia as it is?

text: Look in JuliaText GitHub org for much of it.

elements.text: Look in JuliaText GitHub org for much of it.

text: Outside that org is Transformers.jl, and prob a bunch of other packages I don't know about

elements.text: Outside that org is Transformers.jl, and prob a bunch of other packages I don't know about

text: Thank you, <@U6A936746> and <@U013KHU2XC1>. I'll have a look at those.

elements.text: . I'll have a look at those.

text:
Depending how low level you want to work:
TextAnalysis is probably the go to for “I just want to do a thing”.
(like i used it for topic mapping out internal wiki)

Where as if you want to build a thing yourself:

WordTokenziers is kind of the first step in a wordlevel - ML  process.
(Embeddings,jl goes well here for initializing that bottom layer)

CorpusLoaders.jl gives you training/evaluation data.

elements.text:
Depending how low level you want to work:
TextAnalysis is probably the go to for “I just want to do a thing”.
(like i used it for topic mapping out internal wiki)

Where as if you want to build a thing yourself:

WordTokenziers is kind of the first step in a wordlevel - ML  process.
(Embeddings,jl goes well here for initializing that bottom layer)

CorpusLoaders.jl gives you training/evaluation data.

text: TextAnalysis is a batch-oriented processor. You can create a corpus with text and do analysis. But e.g., a case of similarity calculation between documents in the corpus and one query-document, it is not available out of the box. Whenever the corpus is small, the time for calculation of a document-term matrix is ok. But in the case of a corpus with thousands of documents, it will take valuable time. If I understand right, but not sure, StringAnalysis.jl was created as a fork to resolve these issues with online document processing. Including methods for partial document-term matrix calculations, etc. TextAnalysis is a really rarely updated package.....

Whenever the corpus is small, the time for calculation of a document-term matrix is ok. But in the case of a corpus with thousands of documents, it will take valuable time. If I understand right, but not sure, StringAnalysis.jl was created as a fork to resolve these issues with online document processing. Including methods for partial document-term matrix calculations, etc. TextAnalysis is a really rarely updated package.....
